title: Webpack doesn't remove `type: 'module'` from Worker construction
body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template because we'll close your issue -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of webpack. -->

# Bug report

<!-- Please ask questions on StackOverflow or the webpack Gitter. -->
<!-- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=webpack -->
<!-- https://gitter.im/webpack/webpack -->
<!-- Issues which contain questions or support requests will be closed. -->

When using native module workers in browser, one needs to write `new Worker(...path..., { type: 'module' })`.

Webpack's addition of support for `new Worker(new URL('path', import.meta.url))` helps bridge the gap and write code that is less reliant on bundling, but currently it doesn't remove the `type: 'module'` property, and this leads to issues.

**What is the current behavior?**

When using `new Worker(new URL('path', import.meta.url), { type: 'module' })` in order to have code that works in both browser and outside it, Webpack currently transforms the worker JS into a non-ESM version, and uses `importScripts` in the output for any external chunks, but it keeps the `{ type: 'module' }` in the constructor.

As a result, browser creates a module worker, loads the non-ESM bundle, and fails on `importScripts` - which is not allowed in module workers.

**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce.**

Check out the sample at https://grass-northern-xenon.glitch.me for code, and https://grass-northern-xenon.glitch.me/out/ for the output (see the runtime error in the console).

**What is the expected behavior?**

Webpack should remove the `type` property after bundling. Probably the easiest to do so by wrapping the options argument in a function that does `delete options.type; return options`, or Webpack might want to be smarter when options is a static object literal and delete the options statically. Either one should work fine, and size difference is minimal.

**Other relevant information:**
webpack version: 5.22.0
